docs.snippet: President Trump blamed Democrats and the Mexican government for an increasingly “dangerous” flow of illegal immigrants.

headline.main: Venting on Immigration, Trump Vows ‘No More DACA Deal’ and Threatens Nafta
headline.print_headline: As Refugee Caravan Heads North, Trump Rails Against DACA and Nafta

docs.snippet: A governor’s election in California is a changing of the guard at a moment when the state is involved in a high-stakes battle with President Trump.

headline.main: As Trump Leads a ‘War’ on California, Who Will Lead California?
headline.print_headline: Who Will Lead California as Trump Leads a Battle Against It?

docs.snippet: President Trump, expressing his disdain for Nafta and Obama-era immigration policies, said he will send the military to guard the United States border with Mexico.

headline.main: Trump: Military Will Guard Mexico Border

docs.snippet: Juli Briskman said that Akima L.L.C., a government contractor, dismissed her because it feared her gesture would hurt its business. “Criticism of our leaders should be encouraged,” she said.

headline.main: Woman Who Was Fired for Giving Trump the Middle Finger Sues Former Employer

docs.snippet: The president was on the losing side of a libel ruling that could make it easier for victims of sexual misconduct to sue when they are called liars.

headline.main: ‘A Bit of Divine Justice’: Trump Vowed to Change Libel Law. But Not Like This.
headline.print_headline: Trump Vowed to Change Libel Laws. He Might Not Have Had This in Mind.

docs.snippet: I was a Bush-era political analyst at Sinclair. Its propaganda was bad then, and it’s getting only worse.

headline.main: With Sinclair, We Have Trump TV. America Doesn’t Need More.
headline.print_headline: With Sinclair, We Have Trump TV. America Doesn’t Need More.

docs.snippet: The president calls the paper, which is owned by Amazon’s chief executive, Jeff Bezos, “a lobbyist weapon,” among other things. “There isn’t anybody here who is paid by Amazon,” the editor, Martin Baron, said.

headline.main: To Trump, It’s the ‘Amazon Washington Post.’ To Its Editor, That’s Baloney.
headline.print_headline: Trump Ties The Washington Post To Amazon. Its Editor Is Puzzled.

docs.snippet: The president raised the issue of rape against immigrants and further confused facts on tax overhaul, the trade deficit with China and voter fraud.

headline.main: In West Virginia, Trump Talked About Immigration, China, Voting Fraud and More. We Fact-Checked Him.

docs.snippet: “Both of them are instinctively more concerned about the American economy and things at home,” said Robert S. Ford, the last American ambassador to Syria.

headline.main: They Have Many Differences, but on Syria, Trump Seems Much Like Obama
headline.print_headline: Trump Has Chipped at Obama’s Legacy, Except When It Comes to Syria
